In spite of a troubled history, just like bankruptcy of three on the companies involved and the dispute over ownership in addition to control, which reached the federal courts, the Tampa Bay grow became fully operational at the begining of 2008. It was initially scheduled to open around 2006.

The largest seawater desalination facility the united states, it produces an original 25 million gallons everyday (mgd) of drinking water, to help reduce the growing demand to the area’s aquifers. The plant now provides 10% belonging to the region’s drinking water offer.

The initial project price range was $110m, but this rose to $158m because of additional remediation work with the plant. The South-West Florida Drinking water Management District (SWFWMD) possessed reimbursed $85m to Tampa Bay Water for the plant’s capital cost depending on a partnership agreement.

Within February 2010, the ability passed two final operation tests. The plant was forced to produce 25mgd for 120 consecutive days and nights and was also required to maintain an average of 20mgd for 12 consecutive a few months. Tampa Bay Water will probably now get $31. 25m on the SWFWMD as the plant has cleared the lab tests.

Plant facilities

The original project involved the construction in the seawater reverse osmosis (SWRO) grow itself, a seawater consumption, concentrate discharge system, plenty of chemical storage and dosing services and 24km (15 miles) with product water transmission principal. It was subsequently longer to encompass major fix and remediation work, which included redesigning and replacing many of the first-pass membranes, along along with modifying the chemical amenities, pre-treatment system, flocculation plus sedimentation.

In addition, the sand filters and various pumps were modified, with their installation of an additional filtration. Tampa Bay Water – the regional agency to blame for supplying the needs of a population of approximately 1. 8 million – honored the contract to remediate plus subsequently run the plant to American Water / Pridesa inside 2004.

Tampa Bay seawater desalination grow background
In October 1996, the West Coast Local Water Supply Authority – later to turn into Tampa Bay Water – issued a short call for proposals to style, build, operate and very own a desalination plant. Some vendors submitted proposals inside December 1997 and presenting competitive tenders were obtained in October 1998. Last proposals were received throughout February 1999 and inside July, Tampa Bay Drinking water awarded the contract to be able to S&W Water, a Jewel and Webster – Poseidon Assets JVC, on a layout, build, own, operate, & exchange (DBOOT) basis. Their proposal needed construction to commence in 2001 on a site adjacent to Tampa Electric’s Significant Bend 2, 000MW energy station.

“The Tampa Bay grow crops became fully operational inside 2007. ”
However, within 2000, Stone & Webster possessed declared bankruptcy, leaving S&W Drinking water without an engineering and also construction partner. Later that year, with performance deadlines looming, Poseidon teamed upward with Covanta Energy. Annually on, the replacement went exactly the same way as its precursor. A new company was created to complete the plant, Covanta Tampa Development (CTC), and in August 2001 development finally began.
